  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    Direct Known Subclasses:

extends java.lang.Object
implements PoolableConnection

      • setBorrowed

        public boolean setBorrowed(boolean borrowed)
        Description copied from interface: PoolableConnection
        Sets the borrowed state of a connection and returns the previous state. This method should only be called by the ConnectionPool. It is not a part of the public interface.
        Specified by:
        setBorrowed in interface PoolableConnection

      • returnToPool

        public boolean returnToPool()
        Description copied from interface: PoolableConnection
        Returns the object to the pool. Returns false if an exception occurs, otherwise returns true. Whenever the object is borrowed or returned, #setBorrowed() is called automatically.
        Specified by:
        returnToPool in interface PoolableConnection

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: PoolableConnection
        Resets the state of the object, as if it were newly created.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface PoolableConnection

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Fallback - should not be used. Instead of garbage collection, an attempt should be made to return the object to the pool, but only if it's not in the pool already!
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
